organization.fullName: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

identificationModule.briefTitle: Transit Time Flow Measurement in Coronary Surgery
identificationModule.officialTitle: Transit Time Flow Measurement in Coronary Surgery: The Mutual Influence of Collateral Flow Between Different Coronary Territories on Parameter Metrics

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

leadSponsor.name: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Transit-time flowmetry (TTFM) allows grafts quality control during coronary artery bypass surgery by measuring the flow volume through them.

To date, many studies have deeply studied the predictive role on the graft outcomes of the various flowmetry-derived parameters. One of the least investigated aspects, however, is the mutual influence that two newly realized grafts can have. This possibility would be related to the presence of a more or less developed collateral circulation between the bypassed territories.

The purpose of this study is to assess whether a graft for a territory different than that provided by the left anterior descending artery (LAD) may affect the functionality (measured through flowmetry) of the left internal mammary artery - LAD graft.

primaryOutcomes.description:
The primary aim of this study is to assess whether a graft for a non-LAD coronary target modifies the performance (measured by flowmetry) of the flow in the LIMA\>LAD graft.

PI is expressed by the ratio of the flow volume amplitude and mean flow volume, both quantified by a flowmeter (ml/min / ml/min). An ideal value would be \< 3
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During the surgery, out of cardiopulmonary bypass

secondaryOutcomes.description: under rest conditions and after pharmacological stress. The unit of measure will be ml/min. The average flow should be above 20 ml/min.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During surgery, before and after transient occlusion of the other grafts for non-LAD coronary targets

secondaryOutcomes.description: under rest conditions and after pharmacological stress. The unit of measure will be the ratio between two parameters expressed by ml/min.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During surgery,before and after transient occlusion of the other grafts for non-LAD coronary targets.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: variation of Diastolic filling (%DF) on the right coronary
secondaryOutcomes.description: depending on its dominance or hyperdominance. The unit of measure will be the ratio between two parameters expressed by ml/min. DF% is accepted around 50%.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During surgery,before and after transient occlusion of the other grafts for non-LAD coronary targets.

secondaryOutcomes.description: under rest conditions and after pharmacological stress. The unit of measure will be the ratio between two parameters expressed by ml/min. The identified cut-off is 3% of the total flow.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During surgery, before and after transient occlusion of the other grafts for non-LAD coronary targets.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: mean flow, Pulsatility Index, Diastolic filling (%DF) and Diastolic filling (%DF) in the non-LAD grafts
secondaryOutcomes.description: under rest conditions and after pharmacological stress. The meaf low will be measured in "ml/min". The others will be expressed by the ratio between two parameters expressed by ml/min.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During surgery, before and after transient occlusion of the LIMA>LAD graft

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients with coronary artery disease and an indication for surgical revascularization (coronary artery bypass grafting) who meet the above-described inclusion and exclusion criteria will be enrolled by signing the informed consent the day before surgery.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Patient data (personal data, anthropometric data, cardiovascular risk factors, co-patologies, cardiac history, blood tests, drug therapy, electrocardiogram, echocardiogram, angiography) will be recorded
